reasoning: This describes the type of model proposed, emphasizing its general applicability.
This defines the primary goal of the model, which is to automatically understand the meaning of nominal compounds.
This is the specific type of linguistic structure that the model focuses on.
This specifies the language in which the nominal compounds are analyzed.
This refers to generalizable patterns of meaning formation in nominal compounds.
These are the linguistic features used by the model to infer the productive rules.
This refers to a specific theory or framework used as a basis for the model.
This concept describes the meaning conveyed by nominals in relation to other elements in the sentence.
This refers to broad rules of meaning that apply across different domains.
This refers to meaning that is tied to a particular field or context.
This indicates the type of data used to evaluate the model's performance.
This refers to additional knowledge that may be needed to fully interpret compounds in context.
